key_points: Former US President Donald Trump announces the launch of his own social media platform, TRUTH Social.
The announcement comes nine months after Trump was banned from major social media sites for his alleged role in inciting violence at the US Capitol.
The platform is part of Trump Media & Technology Group (TMTG).
TRUTH Social aims to offer a voice to those silenced by Big Tech, according to Trump.
Preliminary rollout of the social network is scheduled for November, with a full rollout in the first quarter of 2022.
Beyond social media, TMTG plans to launch a subscription video-on-demand service, TMTG+, and enter the cloud-computing space.
Trump criticized Big Tech for suspending his accounts while platforms like Twitter host accounts for the Taliban.
Trump was impeached for his alleged role in the January 6 Capitol riots but was acquitted by the Senate.
An initial attempt at a blog on his website was abandoned due to low traffic.
Trump sued Facebook, Twitter, and Google in July seeking account restoration and punitive damages.
